resources.string: Welcome to our special Alaska cruise! \n You will explore the beauty of nature while experiencing a very comfortable accomondation on our "Volna" ship. We are offering a very interesting adventure that you will never forget!

5 days Alaska cruise \nOur smallest itenerary is 5 days. Within this time you will be able to explore the great Alaska by gliding through the Tracy Arm fjord. Visit to Ketchikan (a plcae you;ll fall in love with), then spend a day exploring authentic totem pole parks.

7 days Alaska cruise \nBy choosing a 7-days itenerary you will call upon the historic mining and fishing towns of Skagway, Juneau and Sitka. Then you will enjoy 2 days at sea to take advantage of our special onboard activities!
9 days Alaska cruise \nThis 9-days itenerary includes 2 unforgettable days at sea, an encounter with Hubband Glacier and stops to handful of the Last Frontier's most treasured towns...
Shopping, Mount Roberts Tramway, Mendenhall Glacier, Alaska State Museum, Red Dog Saloon, Macaulay Salmon Hatchery, Glacier Gardens, The Shrine of St. Therese
Shopping, New Archangel Dancers, The Great Outdoors, Fortress of the Bear, Whale Park, Alaska Raptor Center, Sitka National Historical Park, St. Michael’s Russian Orthodox Cathedral
With its rugged mountains, sweeping glaciers and lush rainforests, Juneau is a scenic wonderland everywhere you look.
Get away from it all at this rustic seaport on Baranof Island that blends Native American traditions and Russian culture
Known as the legendary “Gateway to the Klondike” during the Gold Rush boom, Skagway is a sleepy town frozen in time.

On all our living floors you will find 172 rooms. The first living floor starts with the 5th level and goes up to 16th. All floor have a similar plan with similar rooms locted at the same places. Fisrt number (ex. 5001) indicates the level. To book a room simply look at the sample plan and write the number of wished room in the range of 5001 - 16173.
Do you want additional cleaning service for your room?
Would you like breakfast in room service?
